title: The Fountains of Bernini
creator_credit: Paul Buckhurst, Robert Hillmann and Centre for Mass Communication, Columbia University
brief_description: Takes a look at some of the most important fountains in the history of western art and the life of the genius who created them. The atmosphere of the Baroque Age and Bernini’s own religious, political and aesthetic ideas are conveyed visually as well as through music and narration. Narrated by Steven Gilburn.
